title: Lettering Si Scott style
content:
While in Boston at [TypeCon](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106064714/http:/typophile.com/wiki/TypeCon) last week I came across a window display that caught my eye. Turns out it's the work of [UK designer Si Scott](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106064714/http:/www.siscottdesign.com/). Its beautiful, hand-drawn type with all the nuance of great lettering.

My pic on Flickr:  
 [
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106064714im_/http:/typophile.com/files/216624208_cbb9f4e465_4840.jpg)
](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106064714/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/joepemberton/216624208/)

author: Joe Pemberton

comments.content:
Delightful!  
Wish I had seen that one, I might have stopped in for a well lettered pint ;-)

Actually Chris, it was a sporting goods store... note the basketball in the first O. =)
wow! that's really wonderful. Loved the style.

Slam Dunk! and the name "Lebron" should have been a clue too!  
Don't ever get old Joe, you start to see mirages everywhere :-|

ChrisL

Reminds me a bit of Patrick Griffin's [Heathen](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106064714/http:/www.canadatype.com/showfont.php?id=60)  
A really cool design - I wish I had had that idea!
